greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows, T(n,m) = sigma_{n-m}(m) for n >= 1,  m = 1,2, ..., n.
comment: See A109974 (downward antidiagonals) for details and references. sigma_k(n) is the sum of the k-th power of the positive divisors of n.
This is the triangle read by rows obtained from the array sigma_k(n) for k >= 0, n >= 1, read by upward antidiagonals.
mathematica: Table[DivisorSigma[k, #] &[n - k + 1], {n, 0, 11}, {k, n, 0, -1}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jan 09 2017 *)
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jan 07 2017
